title: New report shines light on the problems with 'chemical recycling' - PIRG
summary: A study by the Federal Governments Renewable Energy Lab reveals that mechanical recycling is more environmentally and economically beneficial than chemical recycling, which uses intense heat to alter plastics' chemical makeup. The study claims that chemical recycling yields worse outcomes compared to virgin plastics and that it only recycles a small percentage of plastic material into new products, contradicting its claims of infinite recycling. The article critiques industry advocates pushing for chemical recycling to be legislatively recognized as an environmentally friendly solution, despite evidence of its negative environmental impacts.

title: Kraken Update Progress on Subsea Laser Scanner Service Activities - Offshore Engineer
summary: Kraken Robotics' SeaVision 3D underwater laser scanning technology assists the offshore energy sector by providing quality subsea asset integrity information, including 3D models and measurements for offshore wind and oil & gas clients. In 2022, the technology acquired over 10 terabytes of subsea data, enabling various applications such as mooring chain inspections and volumetric measurements. Kraken is commercializing a non-contact SeaVision Mooring Chain Inspection Tool aimed at reducing inspection costs and developed tools that automate calibration and measurement processes. The technology is set to be certified for DNV class inspections and ISO performance accreditation in 2023.

title: Topsoe and Fidelis New Energy form Carbon Neutral Hydrogen Technology Alliance - PR Newswire UK
summary: Topsoe and Fidelis have formed a global alliance to produce carbon neutral hydrogen using a combination of Topsoe's hydrogen technology and FidelisH2™ technology, which aims to reduce lifecycle carbon emissions in hydrogen production. Their solution allows for hydrogen production from natural gas with a carbon intensity of 0 kgCO2e/kgH2, contributing to decarbonization across various sectors such as industry and transportation. The partnership aims to scale up the production of clean hydrogen while utilizing renewable resources and carbon capture technologies. The alliance seeks to support the energy transition and take part in achieving net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: Pure Harvest to build more indoor farms in Saudi Arabia - Verticalfarmdaily.com: global indoor farming news
summary: The National Agricultural Development Company (Nadec) has partnered with Pure Harvest Smart Farms to create a large-scale, sustainable agricultural project in Saudi Arabia, focusing on year-round production of high-quality, pesticide-free fruits and vegetables. This innovative farming system integrates advanced technologies and renewable energy to produce crops efficiently in arid conditions, contributing to local food security and sustainability goals. The project aims to expand agricultural capacity while supporting local farmers and enhancing resource conservation. Both companies share a vision aligned with Saudi Vision 2030 for economic diversification and sustainability.

summary: Okinawa Autotech plans to invest €25 million over the next three years in developing new products and powertrains, supported by its new global R&D center in Italy, in partnership with Tacita.
